label: 葦手
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: [Also ashidegaki (葦手書）] Reed script was an eccentric calligraphic style sometimes employed for the transcription of poetry.  The characters, distorted to resemble natural objects, were incorporated into water-margin scenes depicting birds, reeds, rocks, etc. (p. 293n).
